results.title: One man's opinion
results.brief_description:
Episode number 1 of Series “What Do You Think”.
First in a series of discussion-provoking subjects, this film shows how one person’s judgment might reasonably run counter to the majority opinion. This is illustrated in a high-school classroom where a campaign is under way to raise funds for a school project. One student, although he believes in the cause, withholds his support because he disapproves of the high-pressure methods which put individuals on the spot if they are unable to or do not wish to contribute. The audience is asked for their appraisal.

results.title: One man's hunger
results.brief_description: An analysis of the cause of famine in India and the social problem posed by inefficient methods of agriculture and over population. The story of one man who, driven off his own land by circumstances, goes to the town in search of work. He is equally unsuccessful there, and returns to starve in his own village. The problems of usury, religion and caste are brought out.

results.title: One man's garden
results.creator_credit: ONF | NFB, Desmond Dew and Donald Winkler
results.brief_description: A tongue-in-cheek film, a mixture of documentary and dramatic effect, on the subject of garbage in general and, in particular, the part it plays in the life of a young man named Simon, cast in the role of a latter-day Adam. His fateful act of tossing away an apple core sets in motion all we know about litter, waste, garbage dumps, and the most recent development, recycling.

results.title: One man
results.creator_credit: ONF | NFB, Michael Scott and Robin Spry
results.brief_description: A red-hot story of corporate negligence sends ace-reporter Jason Brady into battle against big business, as well as against himself. But can he risk his world—his marriage, his job and possibly the lives of his family and himself—to save innocent children from the devastating effects of industrial pollution? Can one man buck the system and still survive? This gripping drama sensitively portrays one man’s confrontation with himself, his ideals and the realities around him.
